meanings.definition: Relating to or involving both parents.
meanings.sent1: The biparental care of the baby birds ensured they grew up healthy and strong.
meanings.sent2: The biparental decision-making process led to a fair outcome for everyone involved.
meanings.sent3: The biparental team of detectives solved the case in record time.
meanings.sent4: Their biparental effort in organizing the event was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The biparental bond between the two penguins was heartwarming to witness.

meanings.definition: Involving the contribution of genetic material from both parents.
meanings.sent1: The biparental inheritance of traits led to a unique combination in the offspring.
meanings.sent2: The biparental genetic makeup of the child was evident in their features.
meanings.sent3: The biparental gene pool created a diverse range of possibilities.
meanings.sent4: Their biparental DNA resulted in a perfect blend of characteristics.
meanings.sent5: The biparental traits of intelligence and creativity shone through in the child.

meanings.definition: Shared or jointly carried out by both parents.
meanings.sent1: The biparental responsibility of raising the puppies was a team effort.
meanings.sent2: The biparental task of building the nest was completed swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The biparental chore of grocery shopping turned into a fun competition.
meanings.sent4: Their biparental project of redecorating the house brought them closer together.
meanings.sent5: The biparental teamwork in preparing meals made family dinners enjoyable.
